Masculine: All but food for the pine roots.
Green needles to pierce his heart.
Snow covered pines judge his crimes.
I hid from him in the forest.
Immortal trees to witness this ritual.
Return to nature, my beloved one.
Feminine: All but food for the pine roots.
Green needles to pierce her heart.
Snow covered pines judge her crimes.
I hid from her in the forest.
Immortal trees to witness this ritual.
Return to nature, my beloved one.
Plural: All but food for the pine roots.
Green needles to pierce their hearts.
Snow covered pines judge their crimes.
I hid from them in the forest.
Immortal trees to witness this ritual.
Return to nature, my beloved ones.
FirstPerson: All but food for the pine roots.
Green needles to pierce my heart.
Snow covered pines judge my crimes.
I hid from myself in the forest.
Immortal trees to witness this ritual.
I return to nature, loved by noone.

Masculine: His head hit the solid ground.
Where he used to hide from dad.
Smashed his chains to pieces.
He was made of stone.
His sins hidden beneath a rock.
I will sculpt him a tombstone.
Feminine: Her head hit the solid ground.
Where she used to hide from dad.
Smashed her chains to pieces.
She was made of stone.
Her sins hidden beneath a rock.
I will sculpt her a tombstone.
Plural: Their head hit the solid ground.
Where they used to hide from dad.
Smashed their chains to pieces.
They were made of stone.
Their sins hidden beneath a rock.
I will sculpt them a tombstone.
FirstPerson: My head hit the solid ground.
Where I used to hide from dad.
Smashed my chains to pieces.
I was made of stone.
My sins hidden beneath a rock.
I sculpted myself a tombstone.

Masculine: They're coming for me too, Mom.
Probably smelling my rotting heart.
I know that vulture is him.
Save me for last, winged partners.
His blood my sin, their beak my sentence.
Eat his skin, but leave me the bones.
Feminine: They're coming for me too, Mom.
Probably smelling my rotting heart.
I know this vulture is she.
Save me for last, winged partners.
Her blood my sin, their beak my sentence.
Eat her skin, but leave me the bones.
Plural: They're coming for me too, Mom.
Probably smelling my rotting heart.
I know those vultures are they.
Save me for last, winged partners.
Their blood my sin, their beak my sentence.
Eat their skin, but leave me the bones.
FirstPerson: They're coming for me too, Mom.
I can smell my rotting heart.
I know the vultures are in my mind.
Save me for last, winged partners.
My blood's my sin, but I got no sentence.
Eat my skin, but leave my bones.

Masculine: Dad, let me take you for a stroll.
My son, I wish you were the one driving.
Let me pull your rotting body.
Every step vanishes a memory.
Didn't expect vengeance to weight this much.
Even dead, he won't set me free.
Feminine: Mom, let me take you for a stroll.
My daughter, I wish you were the one driving.
Let me pull your rotting body.
Every step vanishes a memory.
Didn't expect vengeance to weight this much.
Even dead, she won't set me free.
Plural: Mom, Dad, let me take you for a stroll.
My children, I wish you were the ones driving.
Let me pull your rotting bodies.
Every step vanishes a memory.
Didn't expect vengeance to weight this much.
Even dead, they won't set me free.
FirstPerson: Sorry folks, let me leave without you.
Kids, I hope you're de ones burying me.
Someone pull my rotting body.
Every step vanishes a memory.
Why does vengeance weight this much.
Even dead, from myself won't ever free.

Masculine: I wish this coffin was empty.
I made his bed myself with oak.
He doesn't even deserve a box.
I had to dress him myself in a pine suit.
Closed it with sixteen nails.
That's why I'm burying him alive.
Feminine: I wish this coffin was empty.
I made her bed myself with oak.
She doesn't even deserve a box.
I had to dress her myself in a pine suit.
Closed it with sixteen nails.
That's why I'm burying she alive.
Plural: I wish this coffin was empty.
I made their bed myself with oak.
They don't even deserve a box.
I had to dress them myself in a pine suit.
Closed it with sixteen nails.
That's why I'm burying them alive.
FirstPerson: I wish my coffin was empty.
I made my own bed with oak.
I don't even deserve a box.
I dressed myself in a pine suit.
Closed it with sixteen nails.
That's why I'm being buried alive.

Masculine: If I dig enough I may bury him in hell.
He didn't deserve this.
I only needed a bullet for him.
I hope his corpse doesn't poisons earth.
Rest in all the peace you've stolen.
Til the day of reckoning, old friend.
Feminine: If I dig enough I may bury her in hell.
She didn't deserve this.
I only needed a bullet for her.
I hope her corpse doesn't poisons earth.
Rest in all the peace you've stolen.
Til the day of reckoning, old friend.
Plural: If I dig enough I may bury them in hell.
They didn't deserve this.
I only needed a bullet for each of them.
I hope their corpses doesn't poisons earth.
Rest in all the peace you've stolen.
Til the day of reckoning, old friends.
FirstPerson: If they dig enough I may end up deep in hell.
I didn't deserve this.
It only took a bullet to kill myself.
I hope my corpse doesn't poison earth.
I'll rest in all the peace I stole.
See you on the day of reckoning, fools.

Masculine: Hence the ashes of the afterlife.
The wood crackling like his soul.
Who thought death would be this warm.
The initial spark grew into a fire.
I saw a face amidst the flames.
Ashes to ashes, he always said.
Feminine: Hence the ashes of the afterlife.
The wood crackling like her souls.
Who thought death would be this warm.
The initial spark grew into a fire.
I saw a face amidst the flames.
Ashes to ashes, she always said.
Plural: Hence the ashes of the afterlife.
The wood crackling like their souls.
Who thought death would be this warm.
The initial spark grew into a fire.
I saw a face amidst the flames.
Ashes to ashes, they always said.
FirstPerson: Hence the ashes of my afterlife.
The wood crackling like my soul.
Who thought death would be this warm.
The initial spark grew into a fire.
I saw my face amidst the flames.
Ashes to ashes, like I always said.

Masculine: I married him for a dollar.
The sheriff shot him at my wedding.
He confessed all sins but one.
Reverend adviced me against revenge.
To me belongeth vengeance, and recompence.
God refused to look at him.
Feminine: I married her for a dollar.
The sheriff shot her at my wedding.
She confessed all sins but one.
Reverend adviced me against revenge.
To me belongeth vengeance, and recompence.
God refused to look at her.
Plural: They married for a dollar.
The sheriff shot them at their wedding.
They confessed all sins but one.
Reverend adviced me against revenge.
To me belongeth vengeance, and recompence.
God refused to look at them.
FirstPerson: I got married for a dollar.
The sheriff shot me at my wedding.
I confessed all my sins but one.
Reverend told them to not avenge me.
Vengeance has no owner. Has no end.
I've met God, and he hates me.

Masculine: His neck snapped and hushed the town.
Daddy took the blame for him.
I wish I was the hangman myself.
My life started when they put an end to his.
His hanging corpse kept looking at me.
I may hang myself after I'm done.
Feminine: Her neck snapped and hushed the town.
Daddy took the blame for her.
I wish I was the hangman myself.
My life started when they put an end to hers.
Her hanging corpse kept looking at me.
I may hang myself after I'm done.
Plural: Their neck snapped and hushed the town.
Daddy took the blame for them.
I wish I was the hangman myself.
My life started when they put an end to theirs.
Their hanging corpses kept looking at me.
I may hang myself after I'm done.
FirstPerson: My neck snapped and hushed the town.
Daddy took the blame for me.
I wish I was the hangman myself.
All life began when they put mine to an end.
My hanging corpse kept looking at them.
I hanged myself after all.

Masculine: He drowned my baby in a bucket.
Father hid the gun in a well.
He held me down there a month.
We all hoped for a wishing well.
There was blood in every bucket.
I still hear him scream at the bottom.
Feminine: She drowned my baby in a bucket.
Mother hid the gun in a well.
She held me down there a month.
We all hoped for a wishing well.
There was blood in every bucket.
I still hear her scream at the bottom.
Plural: They drowned my baby in a bucket.
Father hid the gun in a well.
They held me down there a month.
We all hoped for a wishing well.
There was blood in every bucket.
I still hear them scream at the bottom.
FirstPerson: I drowned my baby in a bucket
I hid the gun in a well.
Didn't dare to come out for a month.
I always hoped for a wishing well.
My blood was in every bucket.
I keep screaming from the bottom.

Masculine: I skinned him like a deer.
He had the strength of a bear.
We ate deer stew under a blue moon.
I spent half a life hunting him down.
He made love to me on a bear skin.
I wrapped his body in the fur of a wolf.
Feminine: I skinned her like a deer.
She had the strength of a bear.
We ate deer stew under a blue moon.
I spent half a life hunting her down.
She made love to me on a bear skin.
I wrapped her body with the fur of a wolf.
Plural: I skinned them like a deer.
They had the strength of a bear.
We ate deer stew under a blue moon.
I spent half a life hunting them down.
They used to make love on a bear skin.
I wrapped their body with the fur of a wolf.
FirstPerson: I got skinned like a deer.
I had the strength of a bear.
Feed me deer stew under a blue moon.
Half my life I've been hunted down.
I made love on a bear skin.
My body wrapped with the fur of a wolf.

Masculine: Mescal warned him about the storm.
He spent eight nights yelling my name.
They scalped him and his men.
He refused to believe in the chief's omen.
I carved a knife out of his bones.
I'm burying him naked, his body painted.
Feminine: Mescal warned her about the storm.
She spent eight nights yelling my name.
They scalped her and her children.
She refused to believe in the chief's omen.
I carved a knife out of her bones.
I'm burying her naked, her body painted.
Plural: Mescal warned them about the storm.
They spent eight nights yelling my name.
They scalped them all.
They refused to believe in the chief's omen.
I carved three knives out of their bones.
I'm burying them naked, their body painted.
FirstPerson: Mescal warned me about the storm.
I spent eight nights yelling their names.
They scalped me and my men.
I refused to believe in the chief's omen.
Three knives carved out of my bones.
I'm buried naked, my body painted.

Masculine: He never dared to leave the town.
When the horsemen came, he cried.
Tales of distant cities drove him mad.
Blood rained from his chest atop the door.
His eyes still watch through the keyhole.
He was left behind, trapped in the valley.
Feminine: She never dared to leave the town.
When the horsemen came, she cried.
Tales of distant cities drove her mad.
Blood rained from her chest atop the door.
Her eyes still watch through the keyhole.
She was left behind, trapped in the valley.
Plural: They never dared to leave the town.
When the horsemen came, they cried.
Tales of distant cities drove them mad.
Blood rained from their chests atop the door.
Their eyes still watch through the keyhole.
They were left behind, trapped in the valley.
FirstPerson: I never dared to leave the town.
When the horsemen came, I cried.
Tales of distant cities drove me mad.
Blood rained from my chest atop the door.
My eyes still watch through the keyhole.
